snippet: Lawmakers said Thursday that they were trying to strike a deal that would avert a fiscal crisis next year when trillions of dollars in tax increases and automatic spending cuts begin to go into force.
abstract: Senior lawmakers say they are moving quickly to take advantage of postelection political atmosphere to try to strike a deal that would avert fiscal crisis in January 2013, when trillions of dollars in tax increases and automatic spending cuts begin to go into force.
lead_paragraph: Lawmakers said Thursday that they were trying to strike a deal that would avert a fiscal crisis next year when trillions of dollars in tax increases and automatic spending cuts begin to go into force.

headline.seo: Congress Sees Rising Urgency on Fiscal Deal
headline.main: Congress Sees Rising Urgency on Fiscal Deal
headline.print_headline: Congress Sees Rising Urgency On Fiscal Deal
